message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

The paper proposes a new approach for selecting bands from hyperspectral images using attention-based convolutional neural networks. This involves identifying the most informative regions of the spectrum with the help of gating mechanisms. The paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with image analysis and classification. It also involves the use of deep learning techniques, which suggests that it could belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves the use of gradient descent for training, which is a common optimization technique used in neural networks, suggesting that it could belong to the neural networks (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with feature selection, which is a common problem in information retrieval, suggesting that it could belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
